title: Yellowstone National Park: Weather
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Weather              Weather       Spring & Fall Daytime temperatures range from 30F to the 60F (0 to 20C) with overnight lows in the teens to single digits (-5C to -20C). Snow is common in the spring and fall with regular accumulations of 12" in a 24-hour period. Be prepared for changing temperatures and weather any time of year: more than anything else, unpredictability characterizes Yellowstone's weather. Always be equipped with a wide range of clothing options. Be sure to bring a warm jacket and rain gear even in the summer. Summer Daytime temperatures are often around 70F (25C) and occasionally 80F (30C) at lower elevations. Nights are usually cool and temperatures may drop below freezing at higher elevations. Thunderstorms are common in the afternoons.  Winter Temperatures often range from zero to 20F(-20 to -5C) throughout the day. Sub-zero temperatures are common, especially at night and at higher elevations. The record low temperature is -66F (-54C). Snowfall is highly variable. While the average is 150 inches per year, it is not uncommon for higher elevations to get twice that amount. For more information, check out our list of seasonal highlights, or read about planning a winter visit.
